title: The Lion and the Unicorn
creator: Richard Harding Davis
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of The Lion and the Unicorn, by Richard Harding Davis. Read by Carolin. What if figures of animals had lives of their own? If the figures of a lion and a unicorn at the shop across the street could talk, what would they say about the little things in life that they see every day on the streets of London? This short story describes the love story of Philip Caroll and Helen Cabot, as witnessed by these two figures.. (Summary by Carolin) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; audiobook; romance; london; actors; writers
